ngiemboon: Yɔɔn ŋwàʼne fóo mbwó mèŋ Pɔ̂ɔ, nyìŋ gẅie à faʼa fàʼ Yěsô Keleto, e Ssé la tóŋo wɔ́ɔn ńdɔg ńgÿo ngàŋntúm Yěsô Keleto, ńzába wɔ́ɔn ngie n gʉa ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wé mbwó láʼ.
en: Paul, a servant of Christ Jesus, called as an apostle  ,# 1:1 1Co 1:1; 9:1; 2Co 1:1 and set apart  # 1:1 Ac 9:15; 13:2; Gl 1:15 for the gospel of God  # 1:1 Mk 1:14  #— #

ngiemboon: Ntyě sǎg páʼ Ssé la láʼ ńkaʼ wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ mbòŋo tà ńgÿo pà ntsẅìnkʉ̀ pé pe fʉ̀ʼʉmvfò ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ ŋwàʼne yé.
en: which he promised beforehand   through his prophets  # 1:2 Lk 1:70; Rm 3:21; 16:26 in the Holy Scriptures #— #

ngiemboon: Wɛ̌ nkʉ̀ gɔɔn nò na Míŋ we Yěsô Keleto gẅie aa Cʉ̀apʉ̀a wege. À la sele ńcʉ́ʼʉ nyìŋ mesoŋ, mé zyé yé na ngẅɛ̀ ndá fùɔ Ndavîd.
en: concerning his Son, Jesus Christ our Lord, who was a descendant of David  ,# 1:3 Mt 1:1 according to the flesh  # 1:3 Jn 1:14; Rm 4:1; 9:3,5; 1Co 10:18

ngiemboon: E Ssé piŋ ńzába yé á gwɔ́ Míŋ Ssé, ńgẅiin metʉ̀. Á lɔg páʼ à la gÿo á zíme tsetsɛ̀ɛ mepfó, mbɔɔ páʼ à la néŋe Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a na yé.
en: and was appointed to be the powerful   Son of God  # 1:4 Mt 4:3 according to the Spirit of holiness  # 1:4 Or the spirit of holiness, or the Holy Spirit by the resurrection of the dead.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la cʉa pɔ́ na yé Keleto ńcÿó gʉm yɔ́ɔn, ńdɔgɔ wɔ́ɔn ńgÿo ngàŋntúm Yěsô Keleto légwɔ́ gie n ge gʉa shwóŋo nò Ssé, tsɛ̀ɛ mengwòŋ ntsèm. Epʉ̀a záb ntʉ́m na yé, ńjúʼ ncwò wé, à cʉa púʼu, pɔ́ ná mekùʼ mbwó Yěsô Keleto.
en: Through him we have received grace and apostleship   to bring about  # 1:5 Or him for; lit him into the obedience  # 1:5 Ac 6:7; Rm 16:26 of faith for the sake of his name among all the Gentiles,  # 1:5 Or nations, also in v. 13,# 1:5 Ac 9:15

ngiemboon: Mbɔɔ pi gí, pi ee na nùɔ pʉ̀a ŋwɛ́, ńtí nue e Ssé ka tóŋo gẅí ngie pi gwɔ́ gí pʉ̀a Keleto.
en: including you who are also called by Jesus Christ.

ngiemboon: M biŋe ńnáa yɔɔn ŋwàʼne mbwó pi metsèm pie pi ee tÿǒsoŋo Loma. Pi pie é Ssé kwoŋo gẅí, áa yɛ̌ à la tóŋo gẅí páʼ pi ge gwɔ́ pʉ̀a pé pie à tsɔ̌ʼ. N ne ńtsɔ́ɔn ngie Tá wege Ssé mbɔɔ Cʉ̀apʉ̀a Yěsô Keleto ne ńcÿó gʉm gí, ńne ńnéŋe mbʉ́lè na pi!
en: To all who are in Rome, loved by God,   called  # 1:7 Rm 8:28; 1Co 1:24 as saints.  # 1:7 1Co 1:2–4

ngiemboon: M vɔ̌g ńcʉa na lezíŋ Yěsô Keleto, ésíe Ssé yɔ̀ɔn na twó sí metsèm, mélàʼmie mé ée tsɛ̀ɛ njÿó jʉʼ ntsèm ńne ńgɔɔn ntí gie pi lɔg ńzáb ntʉ́m na Yěsô Keleto.
en: First, I thank my God through Jesus Christ for all of you because the news of your faith   is being reported in all the world.  # 1:8 Rm 16:19

ngiemboon: Áa yɛ̌ fʉ̀ʼ wɔ́, gie n ne sẅíŋte Ssé, n te nyé té kíme gẅí wɔ́. E Ssé ne ńzsé púʼu. N gɔɔn páʼɔɔn ńgwɔ́ nyìŋ gẅie à ne faʼa fàʼ yé lé ngwòŋ ntʉ́m wé ntsèm, ńne ńtsẅii nkʉ̀ mbòŋo gẅie é líe Míŋ we.
en: God is my witness,   whom I serve with my spirit  # 1:9 2Tm 1:3 in telling the good news about his Son #— #that I constantly mention you,  # 1:9 Eph 1:16; Php 1:3–5; 1Th 1:2; 2Tm 1:3; Phm 4

ngiemboon: N gǐŋ ne sẅíŋte Ssé fʉ̀ʼʉ kɔ́ wɔ́ɔ, ńdúɔ mbwó yé ngie à gÿo, legwɔ́ gẅie n gee ńzɔ́gɔ ńtsɔ́ɔn légʉa mbʉ̀a pi, à pumte na we lekwoŋ.
en: always asking in my prayers that if it is somehow in God’s will, I may now at last succeed in coming to you.

ngiemboon: Á nue n kwaʼ ne ńtsɔ́ɔn létó ńgyá gẅí, légwɔ́ gie n ge gÿo à Zẅìge Ndʉalʉ̌a cÿó gʉm gí, agẅi lézáb ntʉ́m na Ssé, à kẅiʼi ńtʉte.
en: For I want very much to see you,   so that I may impart to you some spiritual gift to strengthen you,

ngiemboon: Ndyɛ̌ʼ ń kɔʼɔ́ gɔɔn pɔ́ ngie n dɔɔn ńtó ńgwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, egi ntí lézáb ntʉ́m na Ssé é kẅiŋte wɔ́ɔn, eyɔ̀ɔn ntí kẅiŋte gẅí gí.
en: that is, to be mutually encouraged by each other’s faith, both yours and mine.

ngiemboon: Mefɛ̌ pɔ́ɔn, pi zsé mboŋó ngie n dǎ kwa tɛʼ létó ńgyá gẅí tá shÿó ké te kẅɛ, tà ńkú lyɛ̌ʼɔɔn. N daa púʼu ńtsɔ́ɔn létó faʼa tsetsɛ̀ɛ pi, tà pi jÿó gí pì páʼ n ka faʼa tsɛ̀ɛ tsɔ́ mengwòŋ pɔ́ jÿó yɔ́b pì la.
en: Now I don’t want you to be unaware,   brothers and sisters, that I often planned to come to you (but was prevented until now  # 1:13 Ac 19:21) in order that I might have a fruitful ministry  # 1:13 Lit have some fruit among you,  # 1:13 Jn 4:36; Rm 15:16; Php 1:22; Col 1:6 just as I have had among the rest of the Gentiles.

ngiemboon: E Ssé la náa yɔɔn fàʼ né mèŋ, áa yɛ̌ n gẅiin létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwó pʉ̀a metsèm, é pʉ̀a pie é la zíʼi zsénò, mbɔɔ pie é la te zíʼi, á mbwó pazsé ŋwàʼne mbɔɔ mbwó pà te zsé.
en: I am obligated both to Greeks and barbarians,  ,# 1:14 Ac 28:2 both to the wise and the foolish.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á gÿo tá n tsɔ́ɔn létó ńtsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo mbwó pi gí, pie pi ee tÿǒsoŋo Loma.
en: So I am eager to preach the gospel   to you also who are in Rome.

ngiemboon: Ngwɔ́ eshʉ́ le kúu wɔ́ɔn á létsẅi nkʉ̀ mbòŋo wɔ́, ée metʉ̀ mie e Ssé lɔgɔ ńgÿo pʉ̀a pie é záb ntʉ́m na yé tsẅɛ́ɛ. À zye na pà Yúndà ńkúu na pʉ̀a pie é té pà Yúndà wɔ́.
en: For I am not ashamed of the gospel,  ,# 1:16 2Tm 1:8,12,16 because it is the power of God for salvation  # 1:16 1Co 1:18,24 to everyone who believes, first to the Jew,  # 1:16 Ac 3:26; Rm 2:9 and also to the Greek.  # 1:16 Jn 7:35

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, nkʉ̀ mbòŋo ne ńgÿo mé zsé páʼ á cʉa púʼu, tá Ssé lɔg pʉ̀a mesoŋ, ńtóŋ pʉ̀a pie ée ndʉŋndʉŋ mvfò yé, á cʉa pɔ́ ndàʼ na páʼ pɔ́ záb ntʉ́m na yé. Etsɔ̌ nzsè ndyɛ̀ʼɛ e te wó wɔ́. Áa mmó gie mé la ŋweʼe tsɛ̀ɛ Ŋwàʼne Ssé ngie: «Nyìŋ gẅie aa mvfò Ssé ńgwɔ́ ndʉŋndʉŋ ńtí nue à záb ntʉ́m na yé zɔ ge láʼ gwɔ́ wó.»
en: For in it the righteousness of God is revealed from faith to faith,  ,# 1:17 Rm 3:21; 9:30; Php 3:9 just as it is written: The righteous will live by faith.   # 1:17 Or The one who is righteous by faith will live,# 1:17 Hab 2:4,# 1:17 Hab 2:4; Gl 3:11; Heb 10:38

ngiemboon: E Ssé zɔɔn ńgwɔ́ tÿǒ lepwó ne ńnyɛɛ ngie à ne ńgyáŋa lóŋ, mélàʼmie pʉ̀a mesoŋ é moŋo yé, ńnéŋe ńgÿo menò tepòŋ. Pɔ́ ne ńdɔgɔ ngÿǒ menò tepòŋ mɔ́b ńtáte nò nénʉ́ léfaʼa fàʼ. E Ssé ne gyáŋa lóŋ,
en: For God’s wrath   is revealed from heaven against all godlessness and unrighteousness of people who by their unrighteousness suppress the truth,  # 1:18 2Th 2:6–10

ngiemboon: mélàʼmie ammó gie à lɔɔn ńgwɔ́ mé zsé na Ssé, pɔ́ gíŋe ne ńzsé yɔ́b zsě. E Ssé la shʉ̀ashʉ̀a ńnyɛɛ wɔ́b yɛ̌ mmó.
en: since what can be known   about God is evident among them,  # 1:19 Ac 14:17; 17:24–27 because God has shown it to them.

ngiemboon: Á zɔɔn ńgwaa gwɔ́, mbà tà fó páʼ e Ssé la nyɛte njÿó, mé fó na shúm sie à la nyɛte, ńzsé ngie ee Ssé, tà mbɔɔ páʼ mé té gyá yé lé nÿɔ́g wɔ́. Mé zsé metʉ̀ mé mie é téen ńdáʼa ḿmaga wɔ́. Á cʉa púʼu, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a mesoŋ le láʼ ngie pɔ́ la te ne ńzsé Ssé wɔ́ wɔ́.
en: For his invisible attributes, that is, his eternal power and divine nature, have been clearly seen since the creation of the world,   being understood through what he has made.  # 1:20 Jb 12:7–9; Ps 19:1–6; Jr 5:21–22 As a result, people are without excuse.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ zsé Ssé, tá pɔ́ té guʼte yé, ésíe yé páʼ á ne ńzɛ́te ngie mé gÿo púʼu, na Ssé wɔ́. Tà ńcʉ́ʼ púʼu, mbà legye sɔ́b la fʉte wɔ́b pɔ́ fʉa mánzsè, ntʉ́m wɔ́b gẅie é gẅiin pɔ́ gʉ̀gʉ̀ zsénò gÿo pɔ́ gwe tsɛ̀ɛ nzěm.
en: For though they knew God, they did not glorify him as God or show gratitude. Instead, their thinking became worthless, and their senseless hearts were darkened.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ kúu sáʼa ngie pɔ́ zsé nò, ńcʉ́ʼ mepʉ̀a.
en: Claiming to be wise, they became fools

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ nyé léguʼte Ssé gie e gẅiin legúʼ, ńgwɔ́ te kwé, ńcʉ́ʼ ńguʼte pɔ́ shúm sẅɛ̀ɛ, é shúm sie é sẅé nyìŋ mesoŋ gẅie aa ńkwé, ésẅé meshʉ̌ŋ, setsɔ́ sẅé menɔ̀ɔn pie é gẅiin mekwò lekùɔ, setsɔ́ sẅé menɔ̀ɔn pie éshwoŋo lepfòm sɔ́b ssé.
en: and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for images resembling mortal man, birds, four-footed animals, and reptiles.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo e Ssé nyé wɔ́b pɔ́ gÿo menò sẅile sẅile mie ntʉ́m wɔ́b la ne ńtsɔ́ɔn, ńdeen ńké ńdɔgɔ légÿo púʼu, ésele ńcʉŋte mbùm yɔb, ńdɔg sele ńtém shʉ́ twó pɔ́b.
en: Therefore God delivered them over in the desires of their hearts   to sexual impurity, so that their bodies were degraded among themselves.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ la nyé nò nénʉ́ gie áa na Ssé, ńcʉ́me nzèm cÿɔ̌nò, á gwɔ́ páʼ pɔ́ cʉ́ʼ ńguʼte pɔ́ shúm sie e Ssé la nyɛte, ńcʉ́ʼʉ faʼa pɔ́ mbwó sɛ̌ shúm. Tá mé gẅiin léguʼte pɔ́ yé mbùʼngwòŋ, ńguʼte yé, á na ngùʼ nkɔ́ɔn né nkɔ́ɔn! Amɛn.
en: They exchanged the truth of God for a lie,   and worshiped and served what has been created instead of the Creator, who is praised forever.  # 1:25 Rm 9:5; 2Co 11:31 Amen.

ngiemboon: Áa mmó gie á la gÿo, e Ssé nyé wɔ́b, pɔ́ gÿo mmó gie nkwaŋá wɔ́b tyé mǒ, tá é gwɔ́ menò mie ée néŋ shʉ́ na pɔ́b. Mezwě pɔ́b nyé mbàŋa ńcʉ́ʼʉ faʼa pɔ́ tsɔ́ panzwě pâ pɔ̌ nuŋe; yɛ̌ ntí légÿo menò, e te ntí gie Ssé la záb wɔ́.
en: For this reason God delivered them over to disgraceful passions.   Their women  # 1:26 Lit females, also in v. 27 exchanged natural sexual relations  # 1:26 Lit natural use, also in v. 27 for unnatural ones.

ngiemboon: Mbàŋa gíŋe ńgÿo yɔ́b pɔ́ púʼu, ńnyé panzwě, letʉ́m sɔ́b cʉ́ʼʉ shÿó, pɔ́ sele ńtsɔ́ɔn tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b pɔ́ páʼ mámbàŋa pɔ́ wetsɔ̌ ge sele nuŋe, á gwɔ́ nò shʉ́ na pɔ́b. Á gwɔ́ púʼu, e Ssé néŋ ngɔ́ʼ kwàʼ na pɔ́b, á fóo na tsẅé tepòŋ yɔ́b.
en: The men   in the same way also left natural relations with women and were inflamed in their lust for one another. Men committed shameless acts with men  # 1:27 Lv 18:22; 20:13; 1Co 6:9 and received in their own persons  # 1:27 Or in themselves the appropriate penalty of their error.

ngiemboon: Páʼ pɔ́ la lʉʼʉ lézsé Ssé la, e Ssé la nyé wɔ́b, legye sɔ́b sie é té tyé zɔ̌ cʉ́ʼʉ sáʼa wɔ́. Pɔ́ cʉ́ʼʉ ńgÿo pɔ́ mmó gie pɔ́ kɔʼɔ́ te gÿo wɔ́.
en: And because they did not think it worthwhile to acknowledge God, God delivered them over to a corrupt mind so that they do what is not right.

ngiemboon: Menò mie Ssé te ne ńkwoŋo wɔ́ pú ńjÿó wɔ́b, pɔ́ gÿo menò tepòŋ, ńgẅiin kegɔ̀ʼ, ńgwɔ́ pʉ̀a ńcÿɔ́g cÿɔ́g, légyá mmó nyìŋ ńkwɔ́ʼɔ lóŋ mǒ pú ńjÿó wɔ́b, pɔ́ zẅéte pʉ̀a, ndʉʼʉ́ ndʉʼʉ́ gwɔ́ tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgẅiin fʉte, akɔ́ sáʼa twó pɔ́b wɔ́ɔ, pɔ́ gÿo gÿo, ńzáb menò twó pʉ̀a,
en: They are filled with all unrighteousness,   evil, greed, and wickedness. They are full of envy, murder, quarrels, deceit, and malice. They are gossips,  # 1:29 2Co 12:20

ngiemboon: ésele ńtÿɔ́g sóon na pɔ́b tsetsɛ̀ɛ pɔ́b, ńgwɔ́ megàŋmbù Ssé, ńzoonte pʉ̀a, ńgwɔ́ ngàŋa ŋáʼtè, ńgwɔ́ panyɛ nnɛ́, éfaʼ meshÿó ntsèm lélɔg ńgÿo nò tepòŋ, pɔ́ té júʼ ncwò metá pɔ́b, mbɔɔ we memá pɔ́b wɔ́.
en: slanderers, God-haters, arrogant, proud, boastful,   inventors of evil, disobedient to parents,  # 1:30 2Tm 3:2

ngiemboon: Legye zága wɔ́b. Pɔ́ kaʼa nò, pɔ́ té gÿo, ntʉ́m wɔ́b léen ńtʉ, pɔ́ ée pate tsɔ́ɔn mezìŋe.
en: senseless, untrustworthy, unloving,  ,# 1:31 2Tm 3:3 and unmerciful.

ngiemboon: Pɔ́ cwoŋo ne ńzsé ngie áa mbwó Ssé, e pʉ̀a pie é gẅiin wɔɔn mà, ée pʉ̀a pie é tyé páʼ mé ge láʼ zẅé wɔ́b zẅé. Táʼ, pɔ́ té fʉate mɔɔn menò fʉate ndàʼ wɔ́, pɔ́ gíŋe ńzẅíŋe nò pʉ̀a pie é ne éfʉate mɛ̌ menò yɔ́b.
en: Although they know God’s just sentence #— #that those who practice such things deserve to die  ,# 1:32 Rm 6:21  #— #they not only do them, but even applaud  # 1:32 Lit even take pleasure in,# 1:32 Lk 11:48; Ac 8:1; 22:20 others who practice them.
